Key Match Events: Anthony Edwards scored 28 of his 37 points in the second half.
The Minnesota Timberwolves overcame a 19-point first-half deficit to beat the Los Angeles Clippers 108-106.
Edwards swished a step-back 3 with 1:12 to play.
Edwards drained another 3 with 34.4 seconds left for a 106-101 lead.
Naz Reid scored 18 off the bench and Donte DiVincenzo added 15 for Minnesota.
Rudy Gobert had eight points and a game-high 18 rebounds.
Norman Powell led Los Angeles with 25 points, James Harden added 22 and Ivica Zubac had 17 points and 16 rebounds.
The Clippers led 96-91 with 4:07 to go, but a three-point play and a 3 by Edwards put the Timberwolves up by one a minute later.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kawhi Leonard scored eight points on 3-of-11 shooting in his second game back after missing the team’s first 34 while recovering from a right knee injury.
DiVincenzo started at point guard in place of Mike Conley, who came off the bench for the first time in his 131 games with the Timberwolves.
Julius Randle had five points for Minnesota on 2-of-10 shooting.
